intro: Stachyphrynium cylindricum, commonly known as the cylindrical stachyphrynium, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf structures. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often arranged alternately along the stem. Its inflorescence consists of small yellow flowers arranged in a cylindrical shape, which gives the plant its common name. Stachyphrynium cylindricum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and swampy areas.
